Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The medical students get aware in the main environmental and occupational risk factors and their health impact; the students learn the main occupational risks in medicine; the students have the basic knowledge of environmental risk assessment; The subject pay attention on the need of diagnostics of environmental and occupational diseases in the future clinical practice; The students get aware in coping and prevention methods of environmental health risks.
description.et: Arstiüliõpilastele antakse teadmised ohuteguritest elu- ja töökeskkonnas. Tutvustatakse terviseriske, mis tulenevad globaalsetest keskkonnaprobleemidest ja on seotud kliima, õhu, pinnase,  joogivee, toidu ja jäätmetega. Teadvustatakse kutseriske oma tulevases meditsiinitöös. Hinnatakse terviseriske ja analüüsitakse seoseid keskkonnategurite ja tervisehäirete vahel. Käsitletakse erinevaid ennetusmeetmeid, mida saab rakendada patsientide nõustamisel ja kutseriskide vähendamisel ja vältimisel oma tulevases ametis.

objectives.en: To introduce the main risk factors in living and work environment; to learn environmental health impact assessment and prevention of diseases caused by environmental and occupational risk factors.
objectives.et: Anda arstiüliõpilastele teadmised elu - ja töökeskkonna terviseriskidest ning nende toimest elanikkonna tervisele. Teadvustada ohuteguritest enam mõjutatud elanike riskirühmi. Tutvustada riskihindamise põhialuseid ja meetodeid. Õpetada keskkonnast tulenevate terviseriskide vältimise ja vähendamise võimalusi.

learning_outcomes.en:
1. The medical students get acquired in the main health risks in environmental and occupational risks and ambient environment related to air, soil, drinking water, food and waste management. 
2. The students get aware in the main occupational risks in medicine. 
3. The students have knowledge in basics of health impact assessment. 
4. The students can use this knowledge in early diagnostics of environmental and occupational diseases.
5. The students know the methods of prevention.
learning_outcomes.et:
1.	Arstiüliõpilased omandavad teadmised ohuteguritest elu- ja töökeskkonnas. 
2.	Tunnevad terviseriske, mis tulenevad globaalsetest keskkonnaprobleemidest ja on seotud kliima, õhu, pinnase,  joogivee, toidu ja jäätmetega. 
3.	Oskavad analüüsida keskkonnategurite ja tervisehäirete seoseid ning hinnata terviseriski tõsidust. 
4.	Teavad ja oskavad ennetada kutseriske meditsiinitöös. 
5.	Tunnevad keskkonnariskide vähendamise ja vältimise võimalusi. 
6.	Oskavad nõustada patsiente keskkonnahaiguste ennetamise suhtes.

independent_work.et:
1. Essay with presentation. Instruction will be available in Moodle under materials. 

2. Homework "How healthy is my own living environment". Instruction will be available in Moodle under materials.
 
3. Home-work "Risk analyses of working enviroment ". Instruction will be available in ÕIS under materials.

4. Problem-based homework "Informing susceptible groups about heat risks". Instruction will be given in the seminar.

5. Problem-based home work "Informing physicians about occupational risks". Instruction will be given in the seminar.

grade_preconditions.et: The final grade will be commonly based on 4 tests, essay, problem-based home works and risk analyses of working enviroment. If the student is not satisfied with the score, he/she has the opportunity to come to the written exam.

grade_evaluation.et:
Essay
Test 1
Test 2
Test 3
Test 4
Problem-based home work 1
Problem-based home work 2
Risk analyses of working environment 

Or written/oral exam

debt_elimination.et:
If you have missed seminars or practical lectures, you should contact the teacher who was responsible for that seminar.

Options to take failed or evaluations not taken yet are available on week 16, by agreement with the teacher also earlier.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: Lecture slides and all other materials uploaded to Moodle.
resources.recommended_materials:
1. Environmental Health: Third Edition (Hardcover) by Dade W. Moeller (2005) 

2. Environmental Health: From Global to Local (Public Health/Environmental
Health) (Hardcover) by Howard, MD, MPH, PhD Frumkin  (2005) 

3. Risk Assessment for Environmental Health (Public Health/Environmental
Health) (Hardcover) by Mark G. Robson (Editor), William A. Toscano (Editor) (2007) 

4. Pediatric Environmental Health (Paperback) 2nd ed. (2004
by Ruth A. Eztel (Editor), Ruth Ann Etzel (Editor), Sophie J. Balk (Editor)

5. Current Occupational & Environmental Medicine (Lange Medical Books)
(Paperback) by Joseph LaDou (Author) (2007) 

6. Our Global Environment: A Health Perspective (Paperback)
by Anne Nadakavukaren (Author) (2005)  

7.	 Pocket Consultant: Occupational Health (Pocket Consultant) (Paperback) by Tar-Ching Aw (Author), Kerry Gardiner (Author), J. M. Harrington (Author) (2007) 

8.	Tosso, H., Merisalu, E. Riskijuhtimise alused. Terviseriskid. TTÜ. Tallinn, 2012.

9. Merisalu, E. Töötervishoid. Riskide hindamine ja juhtimine. TÜ Kirjastus. Tartu, 2016.
